meanings.definition: Convert (data) into a format that can be processed by a computer.
meanings.sent1: I vectorised the information for the computer.
meanings.sent2: The data was vectorised to make it easier for the computer to understand.
meanings.sent3: Why did the computer refuse to eat the vectorised data? Because it was on a byte-only diet!
meanings.sent4: She vectorised the numbers, turning them into digital puzzle pieces for the computer to solve.
meanings.sent5: The process of vectorising the data was like translating a book into a language the computer could read.

meanings.definition: Modify (a program or algorithm) to use vectors for faster processing.
meanings.sent1: He vectorised the code to speed up the program.
meanings.sent2: The algorithm was vectorised to improve its efficiency.
meanings.sent3: Why did the programmer bring a ladder to the computer? To help with the vectorised code climbing to new heights!
meanings.sent4: The team vectorised the software, turning it into a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The act of vectorising the program was like giving it a turbo boost for lightning-fast calculations.
